businessman.text: A report shows that women in your company are earning less than their male counterparts. What do you do?

options.text: Equalize pay immediately (wealth -5, happiness +10)
Gradually raise women’s pay over the next few years (wealth -2, happiness +5)
Ignore the issue, focusing on business growth (wealth +10, happiness -5)

businessman.text: There is pressure to hire more women in leadership roles in your company. What do you do?

options.text: Promote women to leadership positions (wealth -5, happiness +10)
Wait for more qualified female candidates (wealth +10, happiness +5)
Stick to your current male-dominated leadership team (wealth +15, happiness -10)

businessman.text: Your employees, especially women, are asking for better parental leave policies. What do you do?

options.text: Implement generous paid parental leave (wealth -15, happiness +20)
Offer flexible work hours but no paid leave (wealth -5, happiness +10)
Keep parental leave as is (wealth +10, happiness -5)

businessman.text: Your company is struggling financially. What drastic measure do you take?

options.text: Lay off a large portion of the workforce (wealth +30, happiness -20)
Cut executive bonuses and reduce operational costs (wealth +10, happiness -10)
Invest heavily in marketing and expansion (wealth -20, happiness +5)

businessman.text: A key competitor is offering cheaper products by cutting corners on quality. What do you do?

options.text: Cut prices to compete, even if it means sacrificing quality (wealth +15, happiness -10)
Continue focusing on quality and innovation, even if it means higher prices (wealth -5, happiness +15)
Attempt to differentiate through customer service (wealth -10, happiness +5)

businessman.text: There is a push to implement more green initiatives in your company. How do you respond?

options.text: Invest in sustainable practices, even if it costs more (wealth -15, happiness +20)
Incorporate some green initiatives, but focus on profitability (wealth -5, happiness +10)
Ignore the green initiatives and maintain business as usual (wealth +10, happiness -5)

businessman.text: Your company is facing increasing scrutiny over its environmental impact. What is your course of action?

options.text: Implement full transparency and change operations (wealth -20, happiness +15)
Introduce small improvements while continuing operations as normal (wealth -10, happiness +5)
Maintain the current operations and ignore the scrutiny (wealth +15, happiness -10)

businessman.text: A large section of your company’s workforce is pushing for unionization. How do you handle this?

options.text: Allow the workers to unionize and negotiate (wealth -10, happiness +10)
Reject unionization and attempt to break up the movement (wealth +10, happiness -15)
Offer better employee benefits and incentives without unionization (wealth -5, happiness +20)

businessman.text: You are considering expanding your business into a new international market, but the regulations are uncertain. What do you do?

options.text: Proceed with the expansion despite the risks (wealth +15, happiness -10)
Delay expansion until regulations are clearer (wealth -5, happiness +5)
Cancel the expansion and focus on your current market (wealth +10, happiness +5)

businessman.text: The government introduces new taxes on businesses. What do you do?

options.text: Raise prices to offset the new taxes (wealth +5, happiness -10)
Cut employee benefits and wages to maintain profit margins (wealth +15, happiness -20)
Absorb the costs and maintain current prices (wealth -10, happiness +5)

businessman.text: Your company is being asked to address the increasing wealth inequality in the community. How do you respond?

options.text: Increase employee salaries and offer more benefits (wealth -20, happiness +15)
Create more job opportunities without increasing wages (wealth +10, happiness +5)
Do nothing and focus on maximizing profits (wealth +25, happiness -15)

businessman.text: There is an opportunity to merge with a larger company, but it may result in job cuts. What do you do?

options.text: Go ahead with the merger for growth (wealth +30, happiness -20)
Refuse the merger and focus on growing the company independently (wealth +10, happiness +5)
Offer voluntary severance packages to employees before the merger (wealth +20, happiness -10)

businessman.text: Your company has been accused of exploiting workers in developing countries. What do you do?

options.text: Address the issue and improve working conditions (wealth -10, happiness +20)
Pay a fine and continue with current practices (wealth +10, happiness -5)
Deny the accusations and continue as usual (wealth +15, happiness -10)
